hero.title: How Peskas works
hero.subtitle: Peskas turns daily catch records and vessel tracks into decision-ready indicators for small-scale fisheries - with open methods and clear quality control.

pipeline.title: From landing site to insight
pipeline.subtitle: A single pipeline that starts with fishers and ends with trusted information for managers, scientists, and communities. Built in Timor-Leste, now powering implementations in East Africa and Southeast Asia.

stages.title: On-the-ground reporting
stages.description: Enumerators capture standardized trip data and link it with GPS tracks so every record is traceable.

stages.title: Automated, audited pipeline
stages.description: Cleaning, harmonization, and quality flags ensure each dataset is consistent across time, fleets, and locations.

stages.title: Decision tools
stages.description: Dashboards, briefs, and downloads translate the data into practical guidance for policy and daily operations.

workflow.title: The workflow
workflow.subtitle: Each stage is repeatable, documented, and aligned with partner agencies so results remain credible over time.

steps.title: Field data capture
steps.summary: Enumerators collect trip, catch, and price information at landing sites using a standard survey form.
items: Species, weight, gear, crew, and effort recorded on mobile devices
Landing location and trip timing georeferenced
Data synced daily to a secure, versioned database

steps.title: Vessel tracking
steps.summary: Solar GPS units log vessel positions to complement survey data with verified time at sea and fishing grounds.
items: Automatic polling creates continuous tracks
Fishing activity inferred from speed and location
Tracking data linked to trips for effort estimates

steps.title: Ingestion and standardization
steps.summary: All inputs are cleaned, harmonized, and matched to reference tables before analysis.
items: Species names reconciled to FishBase and FAO codes
Weights estimated from lengths when needed
Currency, units, and categories normalized

steps.title: Quality control
steps.summary: Automated rules and 21 quality flags check completeness, plausibility, and consistency.
items: Duplicates removed; outliers flagged for review
Gear, location, and season cross-checks
Audit trail for every accepted or corrected record

steps.title: Analytics and indicators
steps.summary: Standard scripts calculate core metrics for fisheries management and nutrition.
items: Catch-per-unit-effort and production estimates by fleet, gear, and area
Trends in value, prices, and revenue
Nutritional contribution and species composition

steps.title: Publication and feedback
steps.summary: Decision-ready outputs are shared with partners, with regular feedback into the field programme.
items: Public dashboards and downloadable datasets
Briefings for government partners and communities
Continuous refinement of forms, devices, and QA rules

modules.title: Platform modules
modules.subtitle: The core components that keep the pipeline reliable, transparent, and reusable.

items.title: Data collection and tracking
items.body: Landing-site monitoring, onboard tracking, and fisher self-reporting combine to create a traceable effort-and-catch record.
items: Standardized digital catch monitoring for species, weight, gear, crew, and price
GPS vessel tracking (solar and other devices) for routes, speed, and time at sea
Tracks app for fisher-entered trips and catches, online or offline

keyFeatures.title: Key features
items: Open-source code that adapts to different fisheries contexts
User-friendly dashboards for spatial and temporal analysis
Standardized data and terminology aligned with FAO and national protocols
Cloud-hosted architecture for secure, near real-time access
Co-designed workflows that build on existing systems and capacity

faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Straight answers on hardware, costs, data, and customization.

items.q: Is Peskas the solar powered tracking device gadget thing?
items.a: No. Peskas ingests any vessel location data. We have used solar trackers from Pelagic Data Systems, but any compatible GPS hardware can be integrated.
The software is free and open-source. WorldFish can support setup, form adaptation, training, and dashboards as a service.

items.q: How much does vessel monitoring cost?
items.a: Hardware and service vary by volume

items.q: Can I access and use Peskas data?
items.a: Data belong to the fishers and agencies who collect them. Summaries are published to the Harvard Dataverse; individual-level or sensitive vessel tracks are not shared.

items.q: Can Peskas be customized for my country or project?
items.a: Yes. The system is modular and adaptable. Technical documentation and support are available; contact a.tilley@cgiar.org or fill out the request form.

items.q: Do you have manuals and online training modules?
items.a: Most deployments are co-designed and trained in person to avoid misinterpretation. Online modules are in progress.

cta.title: Ready to see it in your waters?
cta.subtitle: We co-design deployments with partners, train local teams, and keep the pipeline open so evidence stays current.
